Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Ple-AB (Plectasin deletion variant, synthetic AMPs, 3S=S, UCSS1a)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid deletion, fungal defensin analog, fungi-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (90%) toPlectasinC: 17%, G: 19%, K: 14%. Residues N5G6 and D11D12 were deleted from plectasin.Activity: active against Gram+ S. aureus ATCC 43300 or ATCC25923 or CVCC546 or E48 (MIC 4-16 ug/ml), S. epidermidis ATCC35984 or ATCC12228 (MIC 2-4 ug/ml), S. dysgalactiae CVCC3938 (MIC 4 ug/ml),  S. agalactiae ATCC13813 or CAU-FRI-2022-01 or CAU-FRI-2022-02 (MIC 2-4 ug/ml), Gram- E.coli  (MIC > 128 ug/ml), Shigella CMCC392 (MIC > 128 ug/ml), S.enteriditis CVCC3377 (MIC > 128 ug/ml), P.aeruginsoa CICC21630 (MIC > 128 ug/ml), and C.albicans (MIC >128 ug/ml).Toxicity: murine RBC: not hemo.lytic at 256 ug/ml.Recombinant production:yeast:Pichia pastoris:  X33 strain,  pPICZaA plasmid, 4 colonies expression level 137-203 mg/L. expressed supernatant was used for activity screen.
Literature Information.Author: Li X, Hao Y, Yang N, Mao R, Teng D, Wang J.2023
Literature Information.Title: Plectasin: from evolution to truncation, expression, and better druggability.
